clusters.title: Poland ‘closer to military conflict than at any time since WW2’ as Nato allies weigh response to Russian drones
clusters.neutral_headline: Poland Says It Shot Down Russian Drones in Its Airspace

items.title: Poland ‘closer to military conflict than at any time since WW2’ as Nato allies weigh response to Russian drones
items.standfirst: Donald Tusk says Poland dealing with a large-scale provocation after at least 19 violations of Polish airspacePoland’s prime minister, Donald Tusk, said the country is closer to military conflict “than at any time since the second world war” as Warsaw and Nato allies weighed a response to an incursion of Russian drones into Polish airspace.Poland scrambled its own and Nato air defences, shooting down at least three drones, as Russia’s attack on Ukraine spread to Nato territory early on Wednesday in the most significant way since the full-scale invasion more than three years ago. Continue reading...
items.content: Donald Tusk says Poland dealing with a large-scale provocation after at least 19 violations of Polish airspacePoland’s prime minister, Donald Tusk, said the country is closer to military conflict “than at any time since the second world war” as Warsaw and Nato allies weighed a response to an incursion of Russian drones into Polish airspace.Poland scrambled its own and Nato air defences, shooting down at least three drones, as Russia’s attack on Ukraine spread to Nato territory early on Wednesday in the most significant way since the full-scale invasion more than three years ago. Continue reading...

items.title: Poland dismisses Russia’s claim drone incursion was unintentional as Ukraine calls for joint European air defence system – live
items.standfirst: Poland’s deputy PM said Russian drones ‘did not veer off course’ but deliberately targeted Poland; Zelenskyy says Europe needs effective air shieldFull report: Poland ‘closer to military conflict than at any time since WW2’ as Nato allies weigh response to drone incursionLubelskie region governor Krzysztof Komorski is leading an emergency meeting with the police this morning. In a post on X, he urged residents to follow the guidance from the relevant authorities.Prime minister Donald Tusk meanwhile said in his latest update that he is in “constant contact” with Nato secretary general Mark Rutte. Continue reading...

In a post on X, he urged residents to follow the guidance from the relevant authorities.Prime minister Donald Tusk meanwhile said in his latest update that he is in “constant contact” with Nato secretary general Mark Rutte. items.title: What a NATO investigation into Russia violating Poland's airspace would look like
items.standfirst: Poland said Tuesday night that Russia violated its airspace with drones during an attack on Ukraine. The incident triggered the NATO Treaty's Article IV. CBS News' Charlie D'Agata has more details.
items.content: Poland said Tuesday night that Russia violated its airspace with drones during an attack on Ukraine. The incident triggered the NATO Treaty's Article IV. CBS News' Charlie D'Agata has more details.

items.title: Poland says it shot down Russian drones in its airspace
items.standfirst: Poland shot down Russian drones with the help of its NATO allies’ military aircraft, it said Wednesday, marking a notable escalation in the tension between Russia and NATO countries since Russia’s war on Ukraine began in 2022
items.content: Poland shot down Russian drones with the help of its NATO allies’ military aircraft, it said Wednesday, marking a notable escalation in the tension between Russia and NATO countries since Russia’s war on Ukraine began in 2022

items.title: UK looking to reinforce Poland's air defences - as EU diplomat warns 'Ukraine war is escalating'
items.standfirst: The UK is looking to bolster Poland's air defences after suspected Russian drones were shot down in its airspace.
items.content: The UK is looking to bolster Poland's air defences after suspected Russian drones were shot down in its airspace.

items.title: Was Russian drone incursion deliberate or accidental?
items.standfirst: Poland shot down what it said were Russian drones in its airspace on Wednesday with the backing of military aircraft from its NATO allies, the first time a member of the Western military alliance is known to have fired shots during Russia's war in Ukraine. The incident will ratchet up tensions between Russia and the West, but NATO's response will largely depend on whether the incursion is deemed to be deliberate or an accident, says France 24's Angela Diffley.
items.content: Poland shot down what it said were Russian drones in its airspace on Wednesday with the backing of military aircraft from its NATO allies, the first time a member of the Western military alliance is known to have fired shots during Russia's war in Ukraine. The incident will ratchet up tensions between Russia and the West, but NATO's response will largely depend on whether the incursion is deemed to be deliberate or an accident, says France 24's Angela Diffley.

items.title: Here’s What to Know About Poland Shooting Down Russian Drones
items.standfirst: On Wednesday morning, Poland shot down several Russian drones that entered its airspace—a first since Moscow’s invasion of Ukraine. The incident disrupted air travel and set the region on edge.
items.content: On Wednesday morning, Poland shot down several Russian drones that entered its airspace—a first since Moscow’s invasion of Ukraine. The incident disrupted air travel and set the region on edge.

items.title: NATO, EU condemn 'Russia's reckless behaviour' after Poland drone incursion
items.standfirst: NATO on Wednesday slammed Moscow's "reckless behaviour" after Russian drones violated Polish airspace, and hailed the alliance's "very successful reaction" to counter the incursion. EU chief von der Leyen meanwhile said Russia had carried out a "reckless and unprecedented" violation of Polish airspace.
items.content: NATO on Wednesday slammed Moscow's "reckless behaviour" after Russian drones violated Polish airspace, and hailed the alliance's "very successful reaction" to counter the incursion. EU chief von der Leyen meanwhile said Russia had carried out a "reckless and unprecedented" violation of Polish airspace.

items.title: The pivotal question for NATO as it decides how to respond after Russian drones violate Polish airspace
items.standfirst: What was Russia's intent? That's the pivotal question as Poland and its NATO allies consider their response to drones violating its airspace.
items.content: What was Russia's intent? That's the pivotal question as Poland and its NATO allies consider their response to drones violating its airspace.

items.title: Poland shoots down 'huge number' of Russian drones
items.standfirst: Poland’s military said it scrambled its own and NATO allied air defenses to shoot down Russian drones on Wednesday after they crossed from neighboring Ukraine, the first time in the Ukraine war that Warsaw has engaged Russian assets in its airspace.
items.content: Poland’s military said it scrambled its own and NATO allied air defenses to shoot down Russian drones on Wednesday after they crossed from neighboring Ukraine, the first time in the Ukraine war that Warsaw has engaged Russian assets in its airspace.

ai_summary: Poland reported shooting down Russian drones with assistance from NATO allies' military aircraft.
The incident occurred during an attack on Ukraine, triggering NATO's Article IV.
Poland's prime minister is in constant contact with NATO's secretary general.
Poland's deputy PM stated the drones deliberately targeted Poland, not veering off course.
Ukraine called for a joint European air defense system in response to the incident.

clusters.title: Hundreds arrested as France protests sweep the country
clusters.neutral_headline: Protests and Arrests in France as New PM Takes Office

items.title: Hundreds arrested as France protests sweep the country
items.standfirst: Protesters across France joined the “Block Everything” movement to denounce austerity and cuts to social services.
items.content: Protesters across France joined the “Block Everything” movement to denounce austerity and cuts to social services.

items.title: Protesters clash with police in France as new PM starts job
items.standfirst: Protesters took to the streets in France in a show of grassroots opposition to President Emmanuel Macron, sparking clashes with police and dozens of arrests. FRANCE 24's James Andre reports from central Paris.
items.content: Protesters took to the streets in France in a show of grassroots opposition to President Emmanuel Macron, sparking clashes with police and dozens of arrests. FRANCE 24's James Andre reports from central Paris.

items.title: New French PM Sébastien Lecornu promises ‘profound break’ with past politics
items.standfirst: Lecornu, 39, faces difficult task of gaining enough support from divided parliament to pass a budgetThe new French prime minister, Sébastien Lecornu, has promised a “profound break” with past politics as he took over from the unpopular centrist François Bayrou, who was ousted this week over a proposed budget squeeze.Lecornu, 39, who said “humility” was the key approach, now faces the difficult task of gaining enough support from France’s divided parliament to pass a budget if he is to avoid being swiftly ousted in the same way as Bayrou, and before him, the rightwing Michel Barnier, who only lasted three months. Continue reading...
items.content: Lecornu, 39, faces difficult task of gaining enough support from divided parliament to pass a budgetThe new French prime minister, Sébastien Lecornu, has promised a “profound break” with past politics as he took over from the unpopular centrist François Bayrou, who was ousted this week over a proposed budget squeeze.Lecornu, 39, who said “humility” was the key approach, now faces the difficult task of gaining enough support from France’s divided parliament to pass a budget if he is to avoid being swiftly ousted in the same way as Bayrou, and before him, the rightwing Michel Barnier, who only lasted three months. Continue reading...

items.title: Continuity Macronism: Will loyalist Lecornu face entrenched opposition as political divide hardens?
items.standfirst: France's new Prime Minister Sebastien Lecornu promised a "profound break" with the past on Wednesday as he faced the thorny task of trying to build a government with enough parliamentary support to avoid an early demise. Lecornu's first day on the job coincided with street protests across France in a show of grassroots opposition to President Emmanuel Macron, which resulted in clashes with police and dozens of arrests, as well as some disruption to transport, schools and other services. For in-depth analysis and a deeper perspective, Oliver Farry welcomes Dr. Andrew Smith, Historian of modern France and Lecturer in Liberal Arts at Queen Mary University of London.
items.content: France's new Prime Minister Sebastien Lecornu promised a "profound break" with the past on Wednesday as he faced the thorny task of trying to build a government with enough parliamentary support to avoid an early demise. Lecornu's first day on the job coincided with street protests across France in a show of grassroots opposition to President Emmanuel Macron, which resulted in clashes with police and dozens of arrests, as well as some disruption to transport, schools and other services. For in-depth analysis and a deeper perspective, Oliver Farry welcomes Dr. Andrew Smith, Historian of modern France and Lecturer in Liberal Arts at Queen Mary University of London.

items.title: Block Everything: 'Protests gaining momentum in Paris'
items.standfirst: France 24's senor reporter James Andre reports live on the 'Block Everything' protests taking place in central Paris where, he says, the demonstrations have been gaining momentum and growing in size over the past few hours.
items.content: France 24's senor reporter James Andre reports live on the 'Block Everything' protests taking place in central Paris where, he says, the demonstrations have been gaining momentum and growing in size over the past few hours.

items.title: New French PM vows 'break' with past at handover ceremony
items.standfirst: France's new Prime Minister Sebastien Lecornu promised a "profound break" with the past at an official handover ceremony on Wednesday as he faced the thorny task of trying to build a government with enough parliamentary support to avoid an early demise. France 24's Clovis Casali was there.
items.content: France's new Prime Minister Sebastien Lecornu promised a "profound break" with the past at an official handover ceremony on Wednesday as he faced the thorny task of trying to build a government with enough parliamentary support to avoid an early demise. France 24's Clovis Casali was there.

items.title: Fire breaks out in central Paris restaurant amid 'Block Everything' protests
items.standfirst: Firefighters were trying to put out a fire in a central Paris restaurant amid a nationwide "Block Everything" protest on Wednesday. France 24's reporter in the French capital Antonia Kerrigan has the latest.
items.content: Firefighters were trying to put out a fire in a central Paris restaurant amid a nationwide "Block Everything" protest on Wednesday. France 24's reporter in the French capital Antonia Kerrigan has the latest.

items.title: Macron government needs to be imaginative, venture beyond familiar ground to find new solutions
items.standfirst: Another prime minister gone. Another crisis unfolding. In France, what once shocked has become routine. Prime Minister François Bayrou submitted his resignation after suffering a crushing defeat in a parliamentary confidence vote. He is the third head of government to fall in just 14 months.For in-depth analysis and perspective, Stuart Norval is joined by Dr. Andrew Smith, Historian of modern France and Lecturer in Liberal Arts at Queen Mary University of London.
items.content: Another prime minister gone. Another crisis unfolding. In France, what once shocked has become routine. Prime Minister François Bayrou submitted his resignation after suffering a crushing defeat in a parliamentary confidence vote. He is the third head of government to fall in just 14 months.For in-depth analysis and perspective, Stuart Norval is joined by Dr. Andrew Smith, Historian of modern France and Lecturer in Liberal Arts at Queen Mary University of London.

items.title: Block Everything: Macron's PM pick adds to anger
items.standfirst: Sebastien Lecornu, picked by President Emmanuel Macron to be France's fifth prime minister in two years, took office on a day of sprawling anti-government protests on Wednesday that underlined the depth of the country's political crisis. Reporting from a protest in Paris, France 24's Antonia Kerrigan says that many of the demonstrators there feel that Macron's choice of Lecornu, a centre-right loyalist from his own party, only adds to their sense that the president is ignoring the wishes of the public.
items.content: Sebastien Lecornu, picked by President Emmanuel Macron to be France's fifth prime minister in two years, took office on a day of sprawling anti-government protests on Wednesday that underlined the depth of the country's political crisis. Reporting from a protest in Paris, France 24's Antonia Kerrigan says that many of the demonstrators there feel that Macron's choice of Lecornu, a centre-right loyalist from his own party, only adds to their sense that the president is ignoring the wishes of the public.

items.title: Block Everything: 'Protests peaceful so far in central Paris'
items.standfirst: Protesters across France disrupted traffic, burnt rubbish bins and at times clashed with police on Wednesday in a bid to "Block Everything" in a show of anger against President Emmanuel Macron, the political establishment and planned budget cuts. However, reporting from a gathering in central Paris, France 24's Antonia Kerrigan says protests there have remained peaveful so far.
items.content: Protesters across France disrupted traffic, burnt rubbish bins and at times clashed with police on Wednesday in a bid to "Block Everything" in a show of anger against President Emmanuel Macron, the political establishment and planned budget cuts. However, reporting from a gathering in central Paris, France 24's Antonia Kerrigan says protests there have remained peaveful so far.

items.title: Without a leader, the Block Everything movement has mobilised protesters in France - how? And why?
items.standfirst: Protesters in France are trying to cause as much disruption as possible as political turmoil continues to plague the country.
items.content: Protesters in France are trying to cause as much disruption as possible as political turmoil continues to plague the country.

items.title: Protesters in France seeking to "block everything" clash with police
items.standfirst: Protests in Paris and across France, venting anger at President Emmanuel Macron's government, see nearly 200 people arrested as fires are set in the capital.
items.content: Protests in Paris and across France, venting anger at President Emmanuel Macron's government, see nearly 200 people arrested as fires are set in the capital.

items.title: Riot police clash with 'Block Everything' protesters in Paris
items.standfirst: Riot police have clashed with protesters in Paris after they took to the streets in response to calls to 'Block Everything' over discontent with the French government.
items.content: Riot police have clashed with protesters in Paris after they took to the streets in response to calls to 'Block Everything' over discontent with the French government.

items.content: Protesters blocked highways and gas stations across France early Wednesday as part of a new nationwide movement.

The new French Prime Minister promised a "profound break" from past political practices.
The new PM faces the challenge of gaining parliamentary support to pass a budget.
Protests disrupted transport, schools, and other services on the PM's first day.

clusters.title: Doha strikes: what next for Gaza ceasefire talks?
clusters.neutral_headline: How Israel’s Attack in Qatar Impacts Possible Ceasefire in Gaza

items.title: Doha strikes: what next for Gaza ceasefire talks?
items.standfirst: Marking a dramatic escalation in the region, Israel's assault on Hamas in Qatar drew widespread condemnation from neighbouring Arab countries and beyond. The country's ruling emir has held a series of calls with world leaders, including U.S. President Donald Trump - who has criticised the attack - amid fears that it is likely to deal a serious blow to efforts to reach a ceasefire in Gaza. FRANCE 24's Emerald Maxwell reports.
items.content: Marking a dramatic escalation in the region, Israel's assault on Hamas in Qatar drew widespread condemnation from neighbouring Arab countries and beyond. The country's ruling emir has held a series of calls with world leaders, including U.S. President Donald Trump - who has criticised the attack - amid fears that it is likely to deal a serious blow to efforts to reach a ceasefire in Gaza. FRANCE 24's Emerald Maxwell reports.

items.title: How will Israeli attack in Qatar affect efforts to end Gaza war?
items.standfirst: Israel's strike on Hamas leaders in Doha is condemned around the world.
items.content: Israel's strike on Hamas leaders in Doha is condemned around the world.

items.title: How Israeli strike on Qatar could impact Gaza ceasefire talks
items.standfirst: Israel's airstrike on Doha, Qatar, targeting Hamas leaders drew condemnation from several countries. President Trump also issued a rare rebuke. Edward Djerejian, former U.S. ambassador to Israel, joins with more.
items.content: Israel's airstrike on Doha, Qatar, targeting Hamas leaders drew condemnation from several countries. President Trump also issued a rare rebuke. Edward Djerejian, former U.S. ambassador to Israel, joins with more.

items.title: How long had Israel been planning its attack in Qatar?
items.standfirst: Details have begun to emerge about Israel's attack on Hamas leaders in Qatar, although many questions remain.
items.content: Details have begun to emerge about Israel's attack on Hamas leaders in Qatar, although many questions remain.

items.title: Israel's attack on Hamas in Qatar: What we know
items.standfirst: Israel on Tuesday conducted a surprise air strike in Doha, Qatar, targeting Hamas leaders and killing six, including the son of the group’s chief negotiator for Gaza ceasefire talks. Here's what we know about this attack what has drawn condemnation from European allies and even a rare rebuke from US President Donald Trump.
items.content: Israel on Tuesday conducted a surprise air strike in Doha, Qatar, targeting Hamas leaders and killing six, including the son of the group’s chief negotiator for Gaza ceasefire talks. Here's what we know about this attack what has drawn condemnation from European allies and even a rare rebuke from US President Donald Trump.

items.title: How Israel’s Attack in Qatar Impacts Possible Ceasefire in Gaza
items.standfirst: As Israel launched an airstrike on a building in Doha, Qatar, where Hamas leaders were meeting, Qatari officials say they were discussing President Donald Trump’s proposal for a ceasefire in Gaza. NBC’s Richard Engel reports for TODAY from Israel.
items.content: As Israel launched an airstrike on a building in Doha, Qatar, where Hamas leaders were meeting, Qatari officials say they were discussing President Donald Trump’s proposal for a ceasefire in Gaza. NBC’s Richard Engel reports for TODAY from Israel.

items.title: Israel's allies condemn Qatar strike that Hamas says leaders survived
items.standfirst: Israel faced an intense new wave of global outrage Wednesday after its attack in Qatar targeting Hamas leaders as they gathered to discuss a U.S. proposal for a ceasefire in the Gaza Strip.
items.content: Israel faced an intense new wave of global outrage Wednesday after its attack in Qatar targeting Hamas leaders as they gathered to discuss a U.S. proposal for a ceasefire in the Gaza Strip.

ai_summary: Israel conducted an airstrike in Doha, Qatar, targeting Hamas leaders.
The attack drew condemnation from several countries, including the United States.
President Trump issued a rare rebuke of the Israeli strike.
The strike killed six, including the son of a Hamas negotiator.
Qatari officials were discussing a ceasefire proposal when the attack occurred.

clusters.title: Israel defiant after international outrage at Qatar airstrike targeting Hamas

items.title: Israel defiant after international outrage at Qatar airstrike targeting Hamas
items.standfirst: Defence minister Katz says ‘there is no place they can hide’ after attack condemned as violation of Qatar’s sovereigntyIsrael has reacted with defiance and further threats in response to international outrage at its strikes targeting a meeting of Hamas’s leaders in Qatar on Tuesday.Amid continuing doubt over whether the missiles fired by Israeli air force planes had killed any of their primary targets, the country’s defence minister, Israel Katz, warned its “long arm will act against its enemies anywhere”. Continue reading...
items.content: Defence minister Katz says ‘there is no place they can hide’ after attack condemned as violation of Qatar’s sovereigntyIsrael has reacted with defiance and further threats in response to international outrage at its strikes targeting a meeting of Hamas’s leaders in Qatar on Tuesday.Amid continuing doubt over whether the missiles fired by Israeli air force planes had killed any of their primary targets, the country’s defence minister, Israel Katz, warned its “long arm will act against its enemies anywhere”. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump says 'not thrilled' by Israel's strike on Qatar
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump gave Benjamin Netanyahu a rare slap on the wrist Tuesday over Israel's strikes against Hamas in Qatar, as he insisted he played no role in the attack by one close US ally against another.
items.content: US President Donald Trump gave Benjamin Netanyahu a rare slap on the wrist Tuesday over Israel's strikes against Hamas in Qatar, as he insisted he played no role in the attack by one close US ally against another.

items.title: Global Outrage Grows Over Israel's Unprecedented Attack in Qatar
items.standfirst: Israel is facing global condemnation after its deadly airstrikes targeting Hamas officials inside Qatar, a key U.S. ally. “I was very unhappy about it,” President Donald Trump said. Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is insisting the strike was fully justified because it targeted senior Hamas leaders responsible for the Oct. 7 attacks. According to Hamas officials, the strike killed five members but failed to assassinate senior members. Qatar, meanwhile, is calling the move by Israel "cowardl
items.content: Israel is facing global condemnation after its deadly airstrikes targeting Hamas officials inside Qatar, a key U.S. ally. “I was very unhappy about it,” President Donald Trump said. Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is insisting the strike was fully justified because it targeted senior Hamas leaders responsible for the Oct. 7 attacks. According to Hamas officials, the strike killed five members but failed to assassinate senior members. Qatar, meanwhile, is calling the move by Israel "cowardl

items.title: Bowen: Diplomacy in ruins after Israel strikes Hamas leaders in Qatar
items.standfirst: The Doha attack signals that Benjamin Netanyahu will press forward hard on all fronts, writes Jeremy Bowen.
items.content: The Doha attack signals that Benjamin Netanyahu will press forward hard on all fronts, writes Jeremy Bowen.

ai_summary: Israel responded with defiance to international outrage over the Qatar airstrike.
Israel's defense minister warned of action against enemies "anywhere."
President Trump expressed unhappiness with the Israeli strike in Qatar.
Hamas claims its leadership survived the Israeli attack in Doha.

clusters.title: Nepal anti-corruption protests explained

items.title: Nepal anti-corruption protests explained

items.content: Protests in Nepal turned deadly after thousands of youngsters marched against the blocking of social media platforms.

items.title: Nepal prime minister quits after deaths at protests sparked by social media ban
items.standfirst: KP Sharma Oli resigns as police meet protests with deadly force, leaving 19 dead, and federal parliament is set alight Nepal’s prime minister has resigned after some of the worst unrest in decades rocked the country this week, set off by a ban on social media and discontent at political corruption and nepotism.KP Sharma Oli’s resignation came a day after widespread protests were met with deadly force by police, leaving 19 dead and hundreds injured. The spark for the protests was a government ban on 26 prominent social media apps, but escalated into a larger mass movement against corruption among political elites. Continue reading...
items.content: KP Sharma Oli resigns as police meet protests with deadly force, leaving 19 dead, and federal parliament is set alight Nepal’s prime minister has resigned after some of the worst unrest in decades rocked the country this week, set off by a ban on social media and discontent at political corruption and nepotism.KP Sharma Oli’s resignation came a day after widespread protests were met with deadly force by police, leaving 19 dead and hundreds injured. items.content: The BBC’s Charlotte Scarr explains how the use of two slogans sparked a wave of protests in Kathmandu.

items.title: Nepal protests 'hijacked', Gen Z claim, as army patrols the streets
items.standfirst: Fierce protests against corruption and nepotism spiralled into arson and violence on Tuesday.
items.content: Fierce protests against corruption and nepotism spiralled into arson and violence on Tuesday.

items.title: Watch: Army patrols streets of Kathmandu after fierce protests
items.standfirst: Charlotte Scarr reports from the Kathmandu where deadly protests against corruption and nepotism took place.
items.content: Charlotte Scarr reports from the Kathmandu where deadly protests against corruption and nepotism took place.

ai_summary: Protests in Kathmandu were against corruption and nepotism.
Protests escalated into arson and violence.
The army is patrolling the streets of Kathmandu.
The BBC's Charlotte Scarr reported from Kathmandu.
The use of two slogans sparked the protests.

clusters.title: Hong Kong same-sex bill that granted limited rights voted down by lawmakers
clusters.neutral_headline: Hong Kong lawmakers say no to more rights for same-sex couples

items.title: Hong Kong same-sex bill that granted limited rights voted down by lawmakers
items.standfirst: The bill, which granted limited legal rights to couples registered overseas, was voted down by lawmakers 71 to 14.
items.content: The bill, which granted limited legal rights to couples registered overseas, was voted down by lawmakers 71 to 14.

items.title: Hong Kong lawmakers say no to more rights for same-sex couples
items.standfirst: The law would have recognised some rights for couples who were married overseas.
items.content: The law would have recognised some rights for couples who were married overseas.

ai_summary: A bill granting limited rights was voted down.
The bill would have recognized rights for overseas married couples.
The vote was 71 to 14 against the bill.
The bill was about same-sex couples.
The bill was voted down by Hong Kong lawmakers.

clusters.title: Princeton academic Elizabeth Tsurkov freed by Iraqi militia after 2 years in captivity
clusters.neutral_headline: Abducted Israeli-Russian researcher Elizabeth Tsurkov freed in Iraq

items.title: Princeton academic Elizabeth Tsurkov freed by Iraqi militia after 2 years in captivity
items.standfirst: A Princeton University graduate student who was kidnapped and held captive by an Islamic militia in Iraq for more than two years was released on Tuesday
items.content: A Princeton University graduate student who was kidnapped and held captive by an Islamic militia in Iraq for more than two years was released on Tuesday

items.title: Abducted Israeli-Russian researcher Elizabeth Tsurkov freed in Iraq
items.standfirst: A Princeton student "tortured for many months" by Iraqi militia is now in the US embassy, President Trump says.
items.content: A Princeton student "tortured for many months" by Iraqi militia is now in the US embassy, President Trump says.

ai_summary: Elizabeth Tsurkov was held captive by an Iraqi militia.
She was a Princeton University graduate student.
She was held for more than two years.
She is now in the US embassy.
President Trump said she was "tortured for many months".

clusters.neutral_headline: A government building struck in Kyiv and a new threat from Trump

items.title: Russian air strikes get deadlier and bigger, hitting Ukraine's very heart
items.standfirst: Ukraine says Russia deliberately hit the main government building in Kyiv with a missile last Sunday.
items.content: Ukraine says Russia deliberately hit the main government building in Kyiv with a missile last Sunday.

items.title: A government building struck in Kyiv and a new threat from Trump
items.standfirst: Trump says he'll respond after Ukraine's main cabinet building was hit
items.content: Trump says he'll respond after Ukraine's main cabinet building was hit

ai_summary: Russia hit a government building in Kyiv.
Ukraine says Russia deliberately hit the building.
Trump said he will respond after the strike.
The strike occurred last Sunday.
The strike was a Russian air strike.
